data.title: New go to place for seafood with a kick!
data.text: Yummy variety of shelled seafood combos -- my favorite is the combo #1 -- 1 lb crab quarters, clams, and shrimp.  One can choose different sauces if chosen -- we usually get the house special.  This dish will feed 3 of us, after appetizers of 8 chicken wings and 2 bowls of chowder.   Really can't imagine anyone giving a bad review.  Service is attentive and not annoyingly so -- just right. Servers NEVER  give the impression of being rushed, when they must be given the crowd that can be there.  Atmosphere is happy and not obviously so.  Liquor is served so yay.

data.title: Excellent Seafood - Well Prepared
data.text: Nice menu, great service, pleasant ambiance. If you aren't sure what to order, try one of the combo plates. More than enough for two!

data.title: Excellent Boils
data.text:
Along the lines of Joe's Crab Shack, this local place on Nob Hill is impressive and well priced. My wife and I got the crab/shrimp/clam boil, 3lbs/1lb a piece, for only $35. It was a very good amount of food that satisfied both the wife and I as a shared entrée. We ordered it with garlic butter seasoning and we didn't even need to dip the crab in butter. The taste and cook was excellent and you can't beat the price. We easily would have been paying $30 a piece at Joe's.

I would highly recommend 99 degrees as one of the best seafood places I have been to in Albuquerque.

The only knock I would put on the place is that I wasn't that impressed with the Oysters on the half shell. But then again, we are in the middle of the desert and I don't expect those to be the best.

data.title: Delicious food, great service.
data.text: The food was fantastic and the service was even better.  We ordered crab legs and shrimp and scallops.  The scallops were overcooked and our service immediately replaced them.  It was wonderful and we will be back.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We had a reservation for 5:30 PM.  The happy hour menu was plentiful and wine half off.  I ordered oysters on the half shell and the shrimp cocktail.  The wife ordered shrimp and fried green beans.  Overall we were very pleased with everything we ordered.  The wait staff was very attentive which made for a pleasant experience.  The dessert menu was ample as well.  If you're looking for something different in the nob Hill area then definitely give this place a try!

data.title: Awful!
data.text: The reason a lot of restaurants use Groupon is to entice customers to come into their establishment with hopes they will return. Not the case in this instance. A small serving of bread for $1.95. The dish we ordered, $49.95, was supposed to be 3 pounds of shrimp, crab and clams. No way was it even close to 3 pounds, and only lukewarm at that. The "noodle dish" was sticky spaghetti. The "jasmine rice" was a cold hunk. The corn on the cob was from frozen and over cooked and too cold to even melt butter. Over priced even with a Groupon. Even the atmosphere is cold and uninviting. Horrible disappointment.

data.title: A True disappointment
data.text: There a several Restaurants that now serve Cajun food like New Orleans,  The choices of how your food was prepared was  limited and each order could be different,  The flavors were no remarkable and our guests said they would not return,  we decided the same.  Down& Dirty is much better and the options greater.N"awl ins on Central is very good also and the Owner came out and talked to us.

data.title: Deliciosa
data.text: I went there with my father after he arrived at the Airport. Their sauces are very good. The garlic butter was the best I've had in quite some time. You can order seafood by the pound of half pound and choose your sauce. They have a limited number of items if you aren't going to order by the pound. Everything we are was very good and the service was impeccable.
